description: 1 x Beech (applicants ref. T1) - Remove deadwood exceeding 30mm in dimeter. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T2) - Reduce lateral branch by 2-3m. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.2 x Oak (applicants ref. G2) - Reduce height by approximately 6m, just above the cavity at 15 meters. Remove deadwood exceeding 30 mm in dimeter. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.Beech Group (applicants ref. G3) - Remove any major deadwood exceeding 30mm in diameter, cut back from streetlight to give a clearance of 2m. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T3) - Retain as habitat but reduce to a height of 2 -3m to lessen the risk of future collapse onto the road. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.2 x Scotts Pine (applicants ref. G4) - Remove deadwood exceeding 30mm, lightly reduce lateral growth over the road by 2m to alleviate weight and lesson risk of future failure. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T4) - Reduce tips by 2-3m, thin throughout the canopy by 20%, remove deadwood exceeding 30mm in diameter. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T5) - Remove dead top. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T6) - Remove major deadwood exceeding 30mm in diameter. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Beech (applicants ref. T7) - Reduce height by 3-4m, to lessen sail area, which in turn reduces the risk of future failure. Remove major deadwood exceeding 30mm in diameter. Standing in Area A3 of Tree Preservation Order.Amended description
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
site_name: Land Adjacent To Holwood HouseNan Clarks LaneLondonNW7 4HH
